</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.55</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the terrain height above the sea for the given position. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[getTerrainHeightASL]] position </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Position2D]] or [[Position3D]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_height = [[getTerrainHeightASL]] ([[position]] [[player]]);</code> </value></part><part><name>Example1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_height = [[getTerrainHeightASL]] [5213,3245];</code> </value></part><part><name>Example2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_seadepth = [[abs]] ([[getTerrainHeightASL]] [[getPos]] [[player]]); <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>sea depth at players position;</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>Example3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setPosASL]], [[getPosASL]], [[getPosATL]], [[ASLToATL]], [[ATLToASL]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 6, 2017 - 20:02 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command can usefully return the depth of water at the given position when in water. Note that the number it returns is the depth, albiet expressed as a negative number. Use [[abs]] to always return a positive number. See example 3

</dd>
